akas: Il nostro piccolo grande amore Italy
akas from release info: Il nostro piccolo grande amore Italy

1.title: Why Do We Have to Move?
1.plot: Bill and Jen go to Florida to hunt for their new home after Dr. Jen accepts a new career as medical director of the simulation center where she was born, Johns Hopkins All Children's Hospital. The family also celebrates Jennifer's birthday.

2.title: Where's the Flyin' Lion?
2.plot: Bill travels to Orlando to showcase his Pop-Up pee pad at a pet industry trade show while Jen teaches her last simulation class at Texas Children's Hospital. Meanwhile, grandmother Judy helps Jen take care of Will and Zoey while Bill is away.

3.title: And I Don't Like Alligators
3.plot: Time is running out and the Kleins still haven't found a new home in Florida! As the move date approaches, they're starting to feel desperate. They need to find a new home, retrofit and sell their Texas house and to add the chaos, Jen's parents visit.

4.title: Yellow Eggs!
4.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

5.title: Time to Leave!
5.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

6.title: It's a Big, Family Road Trip!
6.plot: The house is empty and it's time to leave. 3 generations of Kleins are traveling and they plan on investigating the full spectrum of what the south has to offer! From the largest fire hydrant to the famed Cafe du Monde, the Kleins plan to hit it all!

7.title: We Can Stay Here! Forever!
7.plot: The Kleins are at the homestretch of their trip and as their final stop they visit a cavern. Will Zoey and Will resist the temptation to touch everything inside the caves? Then, Bill supervises the move-in, but Jen is forced to take over when she arrives.

8.title: The Toilet Exploded!
8.plot: The Klein family settles into life at their new house but they have a lot of decisions to make about renovations. They shop for lighting and plumbing fixtures, and test some paint colors with the kids. Then, it's time for some barbecue and pool fun.

9.title: I'm Gonna Catch the Biggest Fish!
9.plot: It's family vacation time! The Klein's, Jen's parents and aunt Barbara head up the Florida coast to visit Jen's sweet great uncle Ray. There, the family learns about sea turtle rescue, goes fishing, and celebrates uncle Ray's 87th birthday!

10.title: A Storm to Be Reckoned With
10.plot: The Kleins start settling into their home but abruptly have to leave town as Hurricane Irma comes barreling towards Florida. The family returns back home to find out just how much damage Irma caused. Then, Will checks into the hospital for a sleep study.

11.title: You're a Fish Approver!
11.plot: The renovations on the Kleins' new house are almost finished! With just last-minute touches to go, the family starts the colossal task of moving upstairs. Then, Bill and Jen make good on their promise and take the kids to get some new pets.

12.title: Will Returns to China
12.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

13.title: I Don't Want to Leave!
13.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

0.title: Pilot
0.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

1.title: Bill Moves to Houston
1.plot: Before she can begin her new job in Houston, newly-wed Jen must travel north one last time to pick up her husband Bill. The couple decides to make the jourey back a little more exciting with a cross country road trip and a pit stop in New Orleans.

2.title: Jen's Birthday
2.plot: It's Jen's birthday and Bill is determined to make it special. Flowers and jewelry just aren't enough for her first birthday as Mrs. Bill Klein, so he whisks Jen out for a romantic dinner after taking her to pick up a specially modified new car.

3.title: Gym, Spa, Shop 'Til Bill Drops
3.plot: It's Bill's first weekend in Houston but Jen has a girl's day planned, so the couple goes their different ways. As Bill sweats up a storm at the gym, Jen enjoys a girls' day of pampering at the spa.

4.title: Work and Play in Galveston
4.plot: Both working impossibly long hours, Bill and Jen always struggle to find free time to spend together. So, when Jen has to lead a workshop on medical simulation in Galveston, TX, Bill tags along, secretly hoping to get her mind off work with a surprise.

5.title: House Hunting
5.plot: The Little Couple decides to take the plunge and begin the process of house hunting. Only one problem, Jen wants something closer to work and the city, while Bill's heart is set on living in a sprawling home in the 'burbs. Can they reach a compromise?

6.title: One Year Anniversary
6.plot: Bill and Jen's first wedding anniversary is only days away but it's hard to focus on romance when they face a mountain of medical bills from Bill's recent surgeries. Can Jen and Bill put aside work and financial tensions long enough to enjoy the day?

7.title: Leavin' on a Jet Plane
7.plot: Bill's off to Baltimore for an extended business trip, leaving Jen to fend for herself in Houston. But he's the trip is not all work and no play; he and his business partner, Michael, find an interesting way to pound away their tension after hours.

8.title: While the Cat's Away
8.plot: Bill's having a guys weekend in Vegas for his brother's bachelor party, leaving Jen just a little nervous. She calls and texts him repeatedly until he finally stops answering, sending her into a panic.

9.title: Bill's 'Honey-Do' List
9.plot: Bill sets aside his own busy work schedule to complete Jen's wish list of home improvements. Later, a visit with a teenage girl who is also a little person offers Jen and Bill a chance to put their parenting skills to the test.

10.title: Hawaii Here We Come: Part 1
10.plot: Jen and Bill cannot wait to leave the stresses of work behind them and head off on their first Hawaiian vacation together. After meeting up with friends Lakshmi and Nikhil, it's off to the golf course for some friendly competition.

11.title: Hawaii Here We Come: Part 2
11.plot: With their vacation days in Hawaii numbered, Jen has them booked solid with all that Hawaii has to offer! Between hula lessons, swimming with dolphins, yoga, shopping, and a luau, Bill may find this relaxing trip anything but!

12.title: The Big Bang Theory
12.plot: When Bill and Jen find a note on their apartment door reporting an attempted break-in in the neighborhood, they decide to beef up their personal security. Jen enrolls in a self-defense class and Jen tries a few of her new moves on Bill at home.

13.title: Wedding Bells Are Ringing
13.plot: The Little Couple jets off to Disney World for Bill's younger brother Joey's nuptials--but it's anything but a vacation! When Jen gets a monster migraine the day of the wedding Bill may have to face his best man duties alone.

14.title: Maybe a Baby?
14.plot: Jen and Bill are anxious to start a family but they have concerns about Jen's safety during pregnancy. So, they've made an appointment with an expert on little people pregnancies. But Jen's first challenge will be breaking the news to her concerned mother

1.title: Waiting to Exhale
1.plot: Our Little Couple make an appointment to determine Jen's lung capacity, an important test in determining her ability to carry a baby. But when Bill makes plans to fly to see a football game, will he be back in time to support Jen when the results come in?

2.title: Take Me Out to the Ballgame
2.plot: Our Little Couple have been invited to throw out the first pitch at a Houston Astros baseball game. But after practicing with some of Jen's new friends at a friendly picnic, will Jen's debut on the mound end up with the strike that she was imagining?

3.title: Rocky's Revenge
3.plot: Bill wants his and Jen's dog, Rocky, to get training while Jen wants to adopt a brand new dog.

4.title: Fish Tales
4.plot: With Jen in Orlando to attend a bridesmaid dress-fitting, our little couple have some good ole fashion fun competing against each other over who can catch the biggest fish.

5.title: Off to See Dr. Oz
5.plot: Jen and Bill head to New York to appear on the Dr. Oz show to discuss skeletal dysplasia for a TV audience, but will their nerves get the best of them as they get closer to showtime?

6.title: New York State of Mind
6.plot: It's a special little couple, as Bill and Jen honor the brave firefighters who were killed in the wake of 9/11 including Bill's own uncle Dennis. Things get even more emotional when they stop off to see Jen's close friend Manju who just had a new baby.

7.title: Boston Bound
7.plot: After a busy weekend in New York, Jen has only a day to travel from New York to Boston where she will participate in SIM Center training. Rather than flying solo, Jen enlists Bill to come along, but things turn chaotic when they lose track of time.

8.title: All Work and Some Play
8.plot: After relaxing in Boston, its time for Jen and Bill to go back to work. Jen stays in town for medical simulation training, while Bill heads to Albany to visit one of his company's call centers.

9.title: To Build or Buy?
9.plot: It's been over a year and the question of buying a new home remains for Bill and Jen. Frustrated, Bill decides to call in the big gun -- Jen's mom. But will this push her in the right direction or further complicate Bi'll's plans for a final decision?

10.title: On Track for Bill's Birthday
10.plot: For Bill's 35th birthday, Jen has a big surprise in store. But when Jen presents him with a "big gift" Bill begins to worry that Jen's plans may be more for her than for him. Things get better when Jen surprises him with an experience of a lifetime.

11.title: Honey, Are You Wearing That?
11.plot: Jen is asked by Texas Children's Hospital to emcee a charity golf tournament of doctors and former NICU patients who don their worst pants, but when the CEO of the hospital invites Bill to join his foursome, will his golf skills be better then his pants?

12.title: The Grand Opening
12.plot: After a year of hard work, the Simulation Center at Texas Children's Hospital is about to open. As Jen prepares her staff for their launch, Bill heads to NYC to work on rebranding his own company. But as Jen's big day nears, will Bill be back in time?

13.title: Now We're Cooking
13.plot: Bill and Jen take up a gourmet cooking class to spice up their meals at home. But the real challenge comes when they both meet up with their builder Miguel to sign the final paperwork on their new home. Will our they finally commit to their dream home?

14.title: Houston, We Have a Problem
14.plot: Bill and Jen welcome their friends to Dallas for a fun filled weekend. With plans to see the lot of their new home and visit a local beach everything is set. But when rain clouds threaten to ruin their weekend will our couple roll with the punches?

15.title: Baby Steps
15.plot: Bill and Jen head to LA to explore the possibility of finding a surrogate mom. They'll learn of the genetic risks of having a baby and what kind of surrogate mom they hope to find. It's an intense day, but at the end will surrogacy still be an option?

16.title: Three Shops and a Baby Doc
16.plot: Our Little Couple have a day off and Jen has only one thing in mind...shopping. But by the end, it is Bill who's caught the shopping bug when he finds a store that caters to men of his stature. Meanwhile, Jen awaits results from a fertility specialist.

17.title: Family Matters
17.plot: Jen, Bill and Will fly to Florida to introduce their new addition to the Klein family! Bill's brother has some surprise news to share with the couple and a question that will change their lives forever.

18.title: Before We Build, We Rent
18.plot: It's moving day for Jen and Bill into their temporary rental. Things get crazy when Bill loses his watch that Jen gave him on their anniversary and when Rocky sneaks under the fence of their new backyard. Will the move be more problems than solutions?

1.title: Breaking New Ground
1.plot: Bill has a brand new look for summer, so Jen decides it's time to get one of her own when she goes to see her trusted stylist for new do. Later, they must both pick out windows and plumbing fixtures for the foundation of their new future home.

2.title: Testing, Testing
2.plot: As Miguel begins pouring the foundation for Jen and Bill's future home, they, too, need to start laying the foundation to build their family. This means a visit to Dr. Hickman at Houston IVF, but will the tests give them positive hope for a future baby?

3.title: There's an Art to It
3.plot: For their second wedding anniversary, our Little Couple decides to keep things low-key, but that won't that won't stop Bill from making things special as hel gives Jen two of everything - flowers, cards, and kisses...

4.title: Runway Dreams
4.plot: It's not your typical date night for the little couple as they head to their first ever fashion show featuring spring dresses by celebrity designer, Chloe Dao. Things get more exciting when Chloe shows Jen how she's going to make a dress for her.

5.title: Spotlight on Jen
5.plot: Jen has been asked to speak at a prestigious pediatric conference in Atlanta. After, she will get to premiere her custom-made Chloe Dao gown at the gala reception. Bill's upgrades his tux to match.

6.title: It's Comedy Tonight!
6.plot: Bill and Jen are in New York City to celebrate Bill's company's five-year anniversary. While they're in the Big Apple, Bill takes a stand-up comedy class and performs on stage.

7.title: A House Taking Shape
7.plot: Bill and Jen's home build is moving quickly. For the first time, Bill & Jen can really feel what the house will be like. Then, Bill is off to New Orleans for his brother Tommy's bachelor party, while Jen does another overnight at TCH.

8.title: Just the Facts, Please
8.plot: Bill heads off to a sales conference in Waterloo, IA, where he's giving his first ever keynote speech. Before leaving, he and Jen finish their internet profile for the Center for Surrogate Parenting. While away, Jen spends another long day at the NICU.

9.title: A Little FAQ
9.plot: In this special episode of The Little Couple, Bill and Jen field viewer questions large and small. We'll go behind the scenes to offer an inside view of the couple over the past three seasons of filming.

10.title: New House, New Hormones!
10.plot: Jen and Bill spend a free Saturday checking up on the construction of their home. Tensions rise as couple decides on a paint color for the house and the placement of Jen's home office. Then, it's time for Jen's first injection of fertility medication.

11.title: Cruisin' to the Caribbean
11.plot: Bill and Jen hit the high seas when Bill's brother Tommy gets married and invites the entire family on a cruise to the Bahamas. After three days of relaxation and adventure, Jen and Bill may never want to go home!

12.title: We Have a Project
12.plot: Jen's parents arrive from Florida, but Dave and Judy's visit is more than just social. With the prospect of Bill and Jen giving them a grandchild, they're considering relocating to Houston.

13.title: Rocky's Companion
13.plot: It's chore day for Bill and Jen. When Jen tells him she's having hip pain, Bill steps up, taking on her tasks so she can rest. While he sweats in the backyard, Jen sips iced tea in the air-conditioned living room, looking at dog adoption sites online.

14.title: What's Up, Doctors?
14.plot: Bill and Jen head to Los Angeles for Jen's appearance on the TV show, The Doctors. It's a great opportunity for Jen as she'll be sitting on the panel as a Neonatology expert alongside the four celebrity doctors that host the show.

15.title: Great Egg-Spectations
15.plot: Jen and Bill are back in LA for their first attempt to retrieve some of Jen's eggs so they can have a baby with a surrogate mother. They head to the doctor for an ultrasound to find out if their baby dreams are finally about to come true.

16.title: Las Vegas Tails
16.plot: Jen and Bill, along with pups Rocky and Maggie, are in Las Vegas to meet up with Jen's parents, Judy and Dave. Since Bill and Dave are looking into opening a pet boutique in Houston, they decide to attend the PetZoo convention and start making contacts.

17.title: 24 Hours in the NICU
17.plot: Jen is headed into the NICU for a 24 hour on call service. It's utterly exhausting, but for Jen, completely satisfying knowing she has seen these dangerously ill infants through another fragile day of life.

18.title: Pushing the House Forward
18.plot: Jen and Bill's new house construction is moving right along. While Jen is needed on a challenging case at the hospital, Bill does his best to communicate her strong visions for the look of the house.

19.title: This Changes Everything
19.plot: This is a big week for The Little Couple: Bill's parents are visiting from Florida and a big conversation with Dr. Boostanfar, their fertility specialist, is on the horizon.

1.title: Third Time's a Charm?
1.plot: Determined to press on with the path of surrogacy, Bill and Jen have switched fertility medications. With the discovery of two mature eggs, will the extraction be a success worth celebrating or will the Little Couple be sent back to the square one?

2.title: Any Way We Want It
2.plot: Bill and Jen travel to Atlanta to speak at a convention about adapting and customizing things in a life with special needs. With their new house and Bill's new car shopping, the Little Couple proves life can be less of a struggle and more of a joyride.

3.title: Yee Haw!
3.plot: With Jen's parents Dave and Judy in town, it's a perfect opportunity to hit the legendary Houston Rodeo. There, they check out the festivities, do some shopping and Bill finally breaks down and buys himself a real Texas cowboy hat!

4.title: Off the Deep End
4.plot: This is one crazy week for The Little Couple. As Jen leaves for a 24-hour on-call shift at the hospital, Bill goes to check how the pool is moving along.

5.title: Home Stretch
5.plot: Jen's mom, Judy, is in Houston to see Jen and Bill and celebrate her birthday. The Little Couple is eager to show her the progress on their new house. While Jen and Judy shop, Bill makes Judy a birthday surprise; a homemade cake in the shape of a horse.

6.title: Dr. Arnold Goes to Washington
6.plot: The Little Couple goes to Washington D.C. to see the sights and lobby a congressman! Jen has been asked to give the keynote speech at a simulation conference and lobby for a bill that will fund medical simulation training.

7.title: Hooray for Hollywood!
7.plot: After Jen and Bill get a promising call from Dr. Boostanfar about their recent tests in the path to starting a family, they head back to Los Angeles. But what was planned as a quick fly-in and a speedy procedure has turned into a waiting game.

8.title: It's Valentine's Day?
8.plot: The Little Couple is still in Los Angeles, stuck in the sunshine as they wait for Jen's eggs to grow large enough to be extracted. Tension is high after their previous failure, will they succeed this time around and harvest an egg they can fertilize?

9.title: In Laws! Incoming!
9.plot: Jen's parents, Dave and Judy are planning to move to Houston, but will need a place to live until they settle in. The big question is where? Will Bill and Jen's new house have enough space to accommodate all of them?

10.title: Another Egg-Cellent Attempt
10.plot: Jen's fertility medication has her swollen with new egg follicles. After a long day in the NICU, Jen and Bill race off to Los Angeles for another attempt at extracting eggs. If they can get a few more, Jen may not need to go through the procedure again.

11.title: Big Apple Anniversary
11.plot: Bill and Jen are celebrating their third anniversary in New York City and they're both full of surprises.

12.title: New House Delays
12.plot: The new house is all lit up for the first time, but Bill and Jen's excitment is short lived. They are still several weeks to go before they can take possession and move in. The pressure rises to finish as the lease on their rental house is running out.

13.title: The Match Game
13.plot: Bill and Jen are invited to do a presentation at a local elementary school. They are asked to speak to kids about bullying. Then, Bill and Jen get the phone call they've been waiting for. It's time for them to meet their potential surrogate face-to-face!

14.title: Will You Be My Surrogate?
14.plot: The road to becoming parents has been a long one for The Little Couple. Finally, they meet Cindy and James, the couple that may be their surrogate family.

15.title: See You Later, Alligator?
15.plot: Jen works with a local interior designer while Bill goes camping with his friend Dave. She warns him about the alligators that inhabit the state park where he'll be roughing it and though he laughs off her concerns, he'll soon finds out how right she is.

16.title: Uncle Bill
16.plot: The Little Couple heads to Florida to meet the newest member of the Klein family, their newborn nephew Riley. Spending time with the baby reinforces Bill and Jen's desire that they're ready to become parents.

17.title: Mother Knows Best?
17.plot: Jen's mom, Judy, is in town to help the Little Couple pack up their rental house. Their interior designer, Michael, shows them his design plans for the new house. Now, all he has to do is win Judy over with his designs.

18.title: There's No Place Called Home
18.plot: Jen and Bill have been living in a hotel, but are desperately trying to find a suitable temporary living situation while their custom home nears completion. The pressure is on because Jen's parents Dave and Judy, are due to arrive from Florida.

19.title: You Bowl Me Over
19.plot: Jen, Bill, Judy, Dave and their five dogs are still living in a rental apartment awaiting their new house to be completed. They hope to move in soon, as the tensions risk bubbling over in the apartment. To blow off steam, the family goes bowling.

20.title: Home at Last
20.plot: After almost two years of waiting, the Little Couple is finally just days away from owning their custom built dream home. After Bill and Jen sign the closing papers, they head straight to the house to pop some champagne and imagine their future life.

21.title: It's All by Design
21.plot: After years of waiting, the Little Couple is on the verge of moving into their new home and getting pregnant at the same time!

22.title: The Start of Something Big
22.plot: Bill and Jen meet with their fertility specialist to prepare to transfer their embryos to their surrogate, Cindy. But now, the chances that both embryos will survive genetic testing look slim and now they have to decide if they're willing to test at all.

23.title: A Little More Q & A
23.plot: In this special episode of The Little Couple, Bill and Jen field viewer questions.We'll also go behind the scenes to offer an inside view of the couple over the past four seasons of filming, revealing even more about their lives.

24.title: Are We Pregnant?
24.plot: The Little Couple takes the next big step toward their quest of becoming parents. Bill and Jen's embryos have thawed, and now it's time to transfer them to their surrogate, Cindy. Will the transfer be successful and Cindy become pregnant?

1.title: Getting Back on Track
1.plot: Some time has passed since The Little Couple received news of their surrogate Cindy's miscarriage. Now, Bill and Jen are ready to move forward, determined to make their family dreams a reality, but will their surrogate feel the same way?

2.title: A Little Thanks
2.plot: It is Bill and Jen's first Thanksgiving in their new home and what better way to test out the custom made kitchen than by hosting a dinner for their friends on the big day.

3.title: Can We Deck the Halls?
3.plot: Bill & Jen get ready to decorate the new house for Christmas. Since Bill's family will be in town for the holidays, Jen hires a decorating service to come out and transform their new house into Texas-sized holiday display.

4.title: Man Cave/Woman Cave
4.plot: Bill and Jen have been loving their new home but find that there's a few more details that can use a personal touch .Bill refinishes the floor of the garage to start turning it into his man cave and Jen decorates her closet to make it her woman cave.

5.title: Four Little Embryos
5.plot: The journey to become parents have brought Bill and Jen back to California for another procedure to transfer embryos to their surrogate, Cindy. Although they are still reeling from Cindy's miscarriage, the couple is remaining positive about this round.

6.title: A Store Is Born
6.plot: Bill has been working hard toward the opening of his pet store. He's picked the perfect location and now needs to renovate and hire employees. Bill and his mother in-law, Judy interview potential employees and Jen gives her opinion on the design.

7.title: A Very Klein Christmas
7.plot: Bill and Jen are looking forward to a big holiday celebration in their new home and this year both of their families are coming to Houston... And they are all staying with Bill & Jen! But during the visit, they wonder if their surrogate Cindy is pregnant.

8.title: Ready, Set, Relax!
8.plot: Life has gotten pretty stressful between busy holidays, work and the recent surrogacy attempt, so Bill has decided to take Jen to Galveston for a surprise weekend at the beach. The time allows them to discuss their most pressing concern, becoming parents.

9.title: Grand Opening Weekend
9.plot: It's Grand Opening Weekend for Bill's new pet store Rocky and Maggie's. But things get complicated when Jen finds out the results of her latest ultrasound, revealing she needs to get to L.A. for an egg extraction during the celebration.

10.title: New Leash on Life
10.plot: Bill and Jen try to put the recent failed egg retrieval behind them and focus on their crazy work schedules. Jen is busy inspecting a new addition to the hospital while Bill brings in a pet psychic to the pet store.

11.title: The Cocktail Party
11.plot: Jen is leading the way in new program with the Houston Fire Department in simulation training. It's the first time the hospital and fire department have come together and to celebrate, Jen and Bill are hosting a cocktail reception in their home.

12.title: A Little Bit Country
12.plot: Jen is the keynote speaker at a health care conference in Nashville and Bill decides to come with her to make a it a trip for the Little Couple. While in the music city, the couple heads out to see the sights.

13.title: A LIttle State Pride
13.plot: Jen & Bill take road trip from Houston to San Antonio.They have been in Texas for four years now and there's still so much of the state they have yet to explore. The Little couple reminisce about their first year in Houston and plans for a family.

14.title: Adopting a New Approach
14.plot: Ever since they decided to become parents, Bill and Jen have considered adopting a child. But now they are taking the next step have and set up a meeting with the founder of an organization dedicated to finding parents for kids with special needs.

15.title: The Golden Son
15.plot: Bill and Jen are anxious to start their family and are continuing down the road of adoption! A child has just become available from China, but will he be a perfect match to join their new family? Now the reality of becoming parents is closer than ever.

16.title: And His Name Is...
16.plot: They're going to be parents at last! Jen and Bill have just learned that they are officially matched with a little boy from China and the process of adopting is moving forward.They discuss possible names and make a scrapbook for him to see his new family

17.title: An Adoption Twist
17.plot: Now that their adoption is moving forward, it's time for the Little Couple to get serious about baby-proofing their home. Then, Jen gets some adoption related news that could change everything.

18.title: Baby Proofing
18.plot: Life is about to change for The Little Couple. After receiving final approval from the Chinese government to adopt their soon-to-be son, they also decide upon the name of the daughter they're in the process of adopting.

19.title: Countdown to China
19.plot: The Little Couple's family is about to get bigger as they prepare to travel to India to adopt their daughter, Zoey. But first, Bill and Jen have a laundry list of things they need to get done before their big trip.

20.title: Road to Parenthood
20.plot: The Little Couple are about to become a Little Family! As Jen and Bill prepare to leave for China to pick up their adopted son, they take a moment to reflect on their roller coaster journey.

21.title: William, Here We Come!
21.plot: Jen and Bill are setting off on the greatest adventure of their lives thus far - flying to China to finally meet their adopted son, William! After years of ups and downs, they now leave Houston knowing that when they return, it will be as parents.

22.title: Best Day Yet!
22.plot: Jen and Bill meet their new son, William, in China, an introduction that makes them nervous and excited at the same time since they don't know how he'll react.

23.title: Finally a Family
23.plot: It's The Little Couple's last days China with their new son William. But before they can leave China they must fly south to Guangzhou, where the American Consulate will provide William with his U.S. Citizenship and he will have to pass a medical check.

24.title: Welcome Home, Will!
24.plot: After traveling around the world to get their new son Will, Jen and Bill take a 28-hour trip back to the states as parents! We join Will, Jen and Bill as they experience lots of family firsts now that their son is finally home.

25.title: Family Fun in Florida
25.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

26.title: Our Five Year Anniversary
26.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

27.title: Back to Work!
27.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

28.title: Check-Up Time
28.plot: Now that Will is home, the Little Couple have decided it's time to take him to see the experts on his skeletal condition. Both Jen and Bill have experienced numerous surgeries and they can only hope that Will won't have to endure the same.

29.title: A Mother's Day Surprise
29.plot: Jen is stuck working at the hospital on her first Mother's Day but while she's away, Bill and Will come up with some special handmade and homemade surprises to make her first mother's day one to remember.

30.title: Will on Wheels
30.plot: The Little Couple have been parents for nearly three months! With all the medical tests Will has been through recently, Jen decide to surprise him with a new tricycle. Then, Bill and Jen explore vehicle options for when they will have two children.

31.title: Bill's First Father's Day
31.plot: It's Bill's first Father's Day and Jen has some surprises planned with Will! Since Will is scheduled to go in for a medical procedures on Father's Day, It's a big surprise for Bill when they celebrate the occasion early.

32.title: Will's First Surgery
32.plot: Bill and Jen knew that by adopting a child with dwarfism, Will would be faced with various medical challenges and surgical procedures. But they quickly learn that being a patient and being a parent of the patient feels very different.

33.title: Time Out for Will
33.plot: After waiting for news about their pending adoption of their soon-to-be daughter Zoey, the Little Couple receives some promising news from India! But before their family of three will become four, Jen wants to get in more bonding time with Will.

34.title: Making a Splash
34.plot: Since arriving in Texas, Will has gained a lot of confidence and independence in navigating his new home. But with independence comes new hazards - specifically, the backyard pool. So Bill & Jen decides it's time for Will to learn how to swim.

35.title: Countdown to India
35.plot: The Little Couple's family is about to get bigger as they prepare to travel to India to adopt their daughter, Zoey. But first, Bill and Jen have a laundry list of things they need to get done before their big trip.

1.title: Zoey Makes 4
1.plot: After over a year of planning and waiting, the Little Couple is finally leaving for India to pick up their adopted daughter, Zoey. The couple has spent months preparing Will for her arrival, but have no idea how the new siblings will react to each other.

2.title: The Unexpected
2.plot: The Little Couple is in India with their 2-year-old daughter Zoey and are so happy that their family is finally complete! Jen starts to feel ill as they travel to New Delhi and with her health on the line, Jen is forced into making a difficult decision.

3.title: We're in This Together
3.plot: Alone with the kids in India, Bill must finish up the final details of Zoey's adoption. Not a moment too soon, their new family is finally reunited in Houston, but now they must face their first family crisis.

4.title: Our First Christmas
4.plot: It's Christmas time in The Little Couple household and this year the holiday has more significance than ever. It's Bill and Jen's first holiday as parents and they're eager to make new memories.

5.title: Our New Normal
5.plot: Life in "The Little Couple" household has changed dramatically since returning from India with second child, Zoey; The couple's "new normal" is a combination of family time and medical necessity but Bill and Jen strive to find a balance.

6.title: Ring the Bell
6.plot: After four months of chemotherapy, Jen and Bill look back at all the challenges they have faced together with their new family all while battling a rare form of cancer. Jen's oncologist stops by to give her some news after her treatment.

7.title: San Fran, Here We Come!
7.plot: The Little Couple packs their bags for a trip to San Francisco! Jen's been invited to give the keynote speech at a conference, but since she is supposed to take it easy, Bill, Will and Zoey are going along to make sure she follows the doctor's orders.

8.title: Tea Time with Zoey
8.plot: The past year has been full of adventures and challenges for the Little Couple as they have expanded their family. Bill takes Will to work with him so that Jen can spend some quality time with Zoey.

9.title: Will's Birthday Party
9.plot: It's Will's fourth birthday! Since it's his first birthday party in the U.S, Bill and Jen want it to be a big deal. They have decided on a safari theme that will be held at the zoo! Alligators, armadillos and giraffe's, oh my!

10.title: Just What the Doctor Ordered
10.plot: Bill, Jen, Will & Zoey are all about improving their family's health and well-being.First, Will has his weekly speech therapy, while Zoey gets her turn with some basic health screenings. Then, Jen's doctor perscribes PTto improve her strength.

11.title: A Grand Time with Grandma
11.plot: When Jen goes back to work, she and the hospital decide to go public with a press conference about her illness as a way of highlighting the successful and challenging treatment. Then Bill and Jen are off to New York where Bill's Mom will get to meet Zoe.

12.title: Back to Business
12.plot: Bill is headed to Orlando to attend a Pet Expo with his mother in law. Jen is catching up on meetings and projects at Texas Children's Hospital and she's watching the kids, the families' two dogs, and her mother's three dogs while Bill is away.

13.title: All You Wanted to Know
13.plot: The Little Couple spends a special hour looking back on how their lives have changed and reflecting on their journey. The Couple answers viewer questions and shares insights into parenting, Jen's battle with cancer and rare behind the scene moments.

14.title: First Easter Together
14.plot: It's Easter and while Jen is doing rounds at the Hospital, Bill is at home teaching Will and Zoey the art of dyeing Eggs. Later they get the kids dressed up and head to a farm where they pick strawberries, meet chickens and try to take family photos.

15.title: Jen's Big 4-0
15.plot: The past year has seen many ups and downs for Bill and Jen. To celebrate her 40th birthday Jen thinks the family is going to Galveston for a beach vacation, but Bill has a big surprise planned for his unsuspecting wife.

16.title: I Do... Again
16.plot: Bill reveals the big surprise he's been planning for Jen, a vow renewal, but is keeping the details a secret. A curious Jen tries to extract info from Will. Later high winds put the ceremony in jeopardy. Will all of Bill's elaborate planning pay off?

1.title: Have a Little Faith
1.plot: After a year of extreme highs and lows, the Little Couple is ready to enjoy everyday life. First, they're off to Florida for the long-delayed baptism of Will and Zoey. Afterwards, they hit the road again, heading to Washington D.C.

2.title: Device Free Day
2.plot: Will and Zoey love their devices and are highly skilled at using technology. But Jen and Bill want the family to take some time away from their handheld screens so they head to Jen's favorite beach in Galveston.

3.title: First Week of School
3.plot: The first day of preschool gives Jen a chance to take some memorable photos. Later, the kids take swim lessons, but Zoey is a slightly slower learner than Will.

4.title: Zoey's Birthday Party
4.plot: Zoey's about to turn 3, so Jen plans a birthday party with a farm theme in honor of her daughter's favorite song, "Old MacDonald Had a Farm." Also: a family trip to Delaware for the kids' annual checkups.

5.title: Bill's Birthday Surprise
5.plot: A trip to a pumpkin patch helps Will and Zoey learn about Halloween before Bill has to leave for back surgery. Later, Bill gets a surprise from Jen and the kids for his 40th birthday.

6.title: Bill's Surgery
6.plot: Bill has surgery on his back. Jennifer and her team at Texas Children's Hospital run an Ebola test scenario. Will and Zoey go trick-or-treating for the first time on Halloween.

7.title: Lift Off!
7.plot: It's been six weeks since Bill's back surgery. Bill's feeling much better but still in pain so Jen and Bill head to New York for a check-up with the back surgeon. Later, the family takes a field trip to NASA/ Johnson Space Center.

8.title: A Little Holiday Spirit
8.plot: It's Christmas time once again for the Klein-Arnold family and Bill and Jen are especially excited because Will and Zoey have a much better understanding of what Christmas is all about this time around.

9.title: New Adventures
9.plot: Jen and Bill think it's time for 4-year old Will and 3-year old Zoey to try some extra-curricular activities. They've decided on karate lessons for Will and ballet for Zoey. And Bill enlists the kids to help out with a special project at home.

10.title: Will's 5th Birthday
10.plot: Will's turning five! Jen decides it's time to re-decorate his bedroom. Also this year, she's stepping aside to let Bill plan the birthday party, Jen's only task is to send out invitations, but when she sends out the wrong address will anyone arrive?

11.title: An Open Book
11.plot: Jen, Bill, Will and Zoey are in New York City for a few days. Both Jen and Bill have appointments with Dr. James Farmer, the orthopedic surgeon who operated on Bill's spine. And they have a meeting with the publishers of their new book!

12.title: A Little Q&A
12.plot: Jen and Bill sit down together for another special Q&A episode to answer as many questions as they can from viewers including video questions submitted via social media.

1.title: Zoey's 4th Birthday
1.plot: It's almost time to celebrate Zoey's 4th birthday and Jen has decided on a princess tea party theme for her daughter's party. Bill is concerned that Jen is going over the top on the party planning, but Jen wants everything to be perfect.

2.title: Back to School
2.plot: As the back-to school date approaches, Bill takes Will grocery shopping for his lunch supplies, Jen and Zoey go for a mani-pedi and both kids get their back-to-school haircuts.

3.title: Safety First!
3.plot: Will and Zoe have a swimming lesson. Later, Jen works at the SIM Center with the Fire Department and gets an invitation to visit a local fire station with the family. 5-year old Will is beyond thrilled to meet real fire fighters and ride in a fire truck.

4.title: A Fashion Show
4.plot: After a visit with the family to Houston Children's Museum, it's time for Bill to focus on the big doggie fashion show his pet store is presenting. Will the crowds turn out and will Bill and his team be able to pull off this ambitious undertaking?

5.title: Big Family Changes
5.plot: Jen's parents are moving to Florida, so the Klein-Arnold family helps them prepare for the move with a garage sale where Will and Zoey set up a lemonade stand.

6.title: A Little Trip to the Big Easy
6.plot: Jen and Bill have written another book, and it's time for a photo shoot for the cover. But, getting a 4 and 5 year old to pose for photos is harder than they think. Later, the family heads to New Orleans where Jen is scheduled to give a speech.

7.title: All Aboard!
7.plot: It's almost Christmas at the Klein-Arnold household. But first, Jen has a huge project at the hospital so Bill takes the kids out to a mini-bowling alley while Jen puts in extra hours at work.

8.title: Mr. Mom
8.plot: Jen has an exciting day at work when the crew from Jeopardy visits the Texas Children's Hospital to film Jen as a guest clue presenter for the show. And when Jen leaves on business for San Diego, Bill is left to play Mr. Mom for a long weekend.

9.title: New Challenges
9.plot: Jen and Bill take Zoey to her first Indian dance lesson. Later the family attends a Chinese lantern festival in Houston. And Jen and Bill have an adult night out at a local escape room.

10.title: A Little 4-1-1
10.plot: In a special Q&A episode, Bill and Jen answer facebook and video questions and go over topics such as parenting, the issues that come with being little people, and what it's like having their own television show.

1.title: Great Scot! The Hurricanes Are Coming
1.plot: The Little Couple is back! Jen is a keynote speaker for work in Scotland and the whole family comes along! They visit a scotch distillery, a castle where Will and Zoey feel quite at home, and Bill decides to try haggis...much against Jen's wishes.

2.title: Hold On Everybody
2.plot: Bill heads to Houston to help his beloved city recover from Hurricane Harvey. Days later they get an unexpected blow from Hurricane Irma.

3.title: He Peed! He Peed!
3.plot: Its back to everyday life in Houston where Bill & Jen keep busy with the kids after-school activities including karate and speech therapy while balancing their own careers. Uncle Joe visits so that he and Bill can test their special pee pad invention!

4.title: I'm a Little Boss
4.plot: Jen's nephew is getting baptized and Jen and Bill have been chosen to be Godparents! The Klines head to Charlotte for baby Nathan's baptism and Will and Zoey surprise their uncle with a homemade birthday cake... taste tested and baked with lots of love!

5.title: I Want to be President
5.plot: The Klines are in DC to host an adoption gala. They visit Mt. Vernon for some historical fun then head to the "Oval Office" where Will steps into a presidential role with ease. Zoey's 5th cupcake birthday is a huge success until a food fight breaks out!

6.title: Quack! Quack! Quack!
6.plot: It's time to have some last-minute fun in DC before the family heads to Delaware for Will and Zoey's yearly check-up with specialists. The entire family relives a tradition that brings both fond memories and tears.

7.title: I Love Candy!
7.plot: When one of Jen's best friends from school comes to visit for the weekend, its constant and crazy fun as Will and Zoey bond with her children. Then it's time to trick-or-treat; the family heads out in their toy cars for a memorable Halloween night!

9.title: Dear Santa, I Love You
9.plot: It's Xmas time and Bill goes all out with the decorations much to Jen's dismay! Bill holds a pet adoption where Will & Zoey decide a new puppy is in order! With family visits, toy drive shopping, and letters to Santa, there's never a dull moment!

10.title: Let's Go in the Snow!
10.plot: Will & Zoey experience snow for the first time in Vermont; Jen & Zoey carefully navigate the snow but the boys throw caution to the wind! Will celebrates his birthday with a sugar high and Jen and Bill contemplate a decision that will change everything...

-1.title: A Sheep is Going to Eat Us
-1.plot: The Little Couple is back! Jen is a keynote speaker for work in Scotland and the whole family comes along! They visit a scotch distillery, a castle where Will and Zoey feel quite at home, and Bill decides to try haggis...much against Jen's wishes.

imdb.title: The Little Couple
plot: The lives of a pair of little people as they continue through their marriage, careers, and starting a family.::Adrianne
